questions.question: Are you speaking ……………………… me or against me?
questions.description: To speak for is to speak on somebody's behalf.

questions.question: It is a crowded place in the evening. Don’t forget to speak ................................... a table.
questions.description: To speak for a table is to reserve it.

questions.question: He is a brilliant actor. His movies speak ……………………………. themselves.
questions.description: When a story speaks for itself, it represents a certain quality.

questions.question: You only have to speak ……………………………… yourself.
questions.description: To speak for yourself is to speak on your behalf.

questions.question: It was a kind gesture that spoke ……………………………. his generosity.
questions.description: Speak of can mean indicate or suggest.

questions.question: Be brave and speak ………………………...
questions.description: To speak out your opinion is to assert it.

questions.question: Every time I hear that song, my eyes become misty. Those lyrics really speak ................................. me.
questions.description: If something speaks to you, it resonates with you.

questions.question: I can’t hear you. Can you speak ……………………………?
questions.description: To speak up is to talk more loudly.

questions.question: He was one of the few leaders who always spoke …………………………. for the poor and the oppressed.
His conduct was despicable but I didn’t dare to speak ……………………….. about it.
You should speak …………………………. him if you don’t want this to happen again.
It was one of the driest years on record – no rain to speak …………………………..
